messages.content: You are tasked with creating a structured output from the provided user message.

Summary
- Resource controller: app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/CommentController
- Routes defined in routes/api.php inside Route::prefix('v1') group.
- The controller exposes three routes (index, show, destroy), so there are two distinct request paths:

1) Path: /v1/comments
- All HTTP methods acceptable: false
- HEAD: false
- POST: false
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: true
- PUT: false
- DELETE: false
- PATCH: false

2) Path: /v1/comments/{comment}
- All HTTP methods acceptable: false
- HEAD: false
- POST: false
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: true
- PUT: false
- DELETE: true
- PATCH: false

Explanation
- routes/api.php registers Route::prefix('v1')->group(...). Inside that group:
  - Route::apiResource('comments', CommentController::class)->only(['index', 'show']); registers the list and detail routes:
    - GET /v1/comments -> CommentController@index
    - GET /v1/comments/{comment} -> CommentController@show
  - Inside the auth middleware group the file also registers:
    - Route::apiResource('comments', CommentController::class)->only('destroy'); which registers:
      - DELETE /v1/comments/{comment} -> CommentController@destroy
- The controller itself implements index (returns paginated list) and show (returns single resource) and destroy (deletes resource). Those correspond exactly to GET (index/show) and DELETE (destroy).
- I did not mark HEAD, OPTIONS, TRACE, POST, PUT, PATCH, or "all methods" as acceptable because they are not explicitly provided by the route definitions or controller methods in the provided code. (Per your instruction, I based the allowed methods strictly on the code/routes rather than framework runtime behaviors such as automatic HEAD handling.)

message.content:
{
  "arbitrary": false,
  "delete": false,
  "get": true,
  "head": false,
  "options": false,
  "patch": false,
  "path": "/v1/comments",
  "post": false,
  "put": false,
  "trace": false
}
